website_summaries.verdict: If you need access to a dedicated machine for large faxing jobs, this is the best.
cons: Deep sleep" energy-saving mode can cause issues, though owners have found solutions

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd unit I have purchased. Likewise ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd unit I have purchased. Likewise it's the 2nd time that I'm getting paper size mismatch errors. Called brother and they are literally impossible to deal with. Buyer beware, it's a cheap unit with absolutely no support. If you need brother for anything they hassle you to death, and by the time anything gets decided they just cancel the ticket out of the system. DO NOT BUY BROTHER PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.author: Jason S Chvat

customer_reviews.title: Horrible machine,  even worse customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am a doctor who needs a fax machine for refilling prescriptions. I ordered this one and it never worked correctly, not even once. All the faxes came but they were all half blank. I called Brother's tech support and three times, after much time spent on hold, I was told there was nothing wrong with the fax machine, that the problem was with my phone line. I knew this was bs, but I had finally had enough of getting the run around so went out and bought a different fax machine. Low and behold it worked, nothing wrong with the phone line or the connection. Don't waste your time with a Brother product!!! Oh brother, do they ever suck!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C Weisser

customer_reviews.title: Trouble Free Service
customer_reviews.text: We use it in the home office. We had a similar model that stopped advancing the paper into the scanner, even when it was hand-fed. That unit was about 12 years old. It gave us trouble-free service. We like the quality and design features of Brother products. Considering what the machine can do, the footprint is pretty compact. We look forward to years of good service.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this FAX machine...
customer_reviews.text: If you want a reasonably priced, reliable dedicated FAX machine for small-to-medium work loads, this Brother FAX machine should certainly be considered. Basic with no bells and whistles, this machine simply does a nice job faxing black and white documents. Selling for the full price of around $199.99, you should be able to find it on sale at Amazon or Staples at $149.99. I got mine at the very reasonable price of $114.99 on Amazon. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MitchFlys

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality within both speed also laser print!
customer_reviews.text: Simply perfect for my small business need. Takes a little patience on setting up all options, yet worth the money for solid built "Brother" 2840 fax/copier machine.
customer_reviews.author: William Haynes

customer_reviews.title: not as informative or easy to search as on other older machines
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, replaced an older fax machine that had trouble sending/receiving over a T-Mobile mobile internet line. Main issues are the Deep Sleep which you will not receive incoming faxes, so read the other reviews on how to disable this. And the display is not backlit so hard to read. Call log, fax reports, not as informative or easy to search as on other older machines. But limited options and this solved the need to send/receive faxes
customer_reviews.author: acemooch

customer_reviews.title: Scanner does not work
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as tech could not get the scanner to work. Otherwise it appeared to be a good machine. Apparently Window 10 does not have drivers for many of these products. So company tech has to create or try to find a working driver. My computer is 2 years old and a PC
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 months ago and quite a few faxes later things are working great. Machine is on 24/7. Just got the "low toner" alert so ordered a pair of the generic refills which I have not yet installed. Follow the directions to disable the deep sleep mode from the helpful reviewer. I did when I set it up and had no issues. Set up was fast and easy by the way. Price seems to cycle up and down on Amazon and I bought it on one of the dips. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent copier and printer except it does not have wireless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item from the seller. Seedwish18... The copier worked perfectly but I had to return it when I realized it didn't have wireless capabilities. Seedwish18 returned it without a hassle and I was very appreciative since I should have realized it didn't have wireless capabilities but iy is an excellent unit and I would recommend it highly
customer_reviews.author: ENRICO PALAZZO

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I was totally amazed when I opened the box and unpacked my machine. I've always had Brother printers, copiers and fax machines but I didn't exactly know what I was ordering. This machine takes a Toner Cartridge and the paper goes into the drawer just like my printers. But the best surprise for me was when I checked the Toner cartridge and discovered it was the same one as my two brother printers that I have in my office take. Using it as a "dedicated fax machine" is so simple that even a tech-difficient person such as myself has no problem whatsoever hooking it up and using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good machine--faxes and copies
customer_reviews.text: Was kidded by co-workers for getting a fax machine since they seem to be used less and less but I have used it on several occasions recently and it performed flawlessly. The copy feature is one reason I am glad to have the device, too. Set up was fairly easy, too, although had to call Brother for some small issue. The support staff walked me through it quickly and have had no troubles at all from that point.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Similar to the brother fax 2820
customer_reviews.text: So far good... I used the brother fax-2820 for years, until it went out... bought this 2840 that looks pretty much a like, only faster faxing and coping, and can load a little more paper into feed, documents come out clear, and setup was simple just like the 2820... did not give 4 stars because it's still too early to tell if it will last.
customer_reviews.author: MinnieWinnie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Brother brand purchase. It was well packed from the factory. It was not double boxed. Was very easy to set up. Print quality is good. I have not had any issue with "Deep Sleep" mode as others have noted here. My only complaint so far is the internal speaker. The sound quality is as bad as it can get. Very scratchy. Other than that, it seems to perform well in my home office environment. Will see very slight use. So for me, this was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle C.

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable fax machine
customer_reviews.text: For those that need a fax machine in this modern age of email and mms, like my Dad who is one of the smartest persons I know, but is clueless when it comes to tech stuff. Some people like the simplicity of it and its low tech. This fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: LANCE

customer_reviews.title: Love the copies.
customer_reviews.text: We use the FAX2840 more for copies than fax but it does both tasks well. I have bought several other machines in the past and they worked reasonably well but didn't last very long. I have great hopes for this one and so far we are very happy with it. It is connected to an external answering machine and there have been no problems there. The paper tray hold a ample amount of paper so it does not need reloading as often and the copies are as clear as the original. It produces the copies very fast which is a real plus.I think it is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: does NOT scan in COLOR
customer_reviews.text: The printer works fine, however, it does NOT scan in color. Really?...no color scanning? That seems antiquated, especially for something that costs $250. Also, because it is a document scanner, you really can't scan photos or anything that is the slightest bit rigid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Brother printers for 30 years. Excellent, reliable product. I don’t like the way this one “forces” a cartridge change, but I can forgive it because it does so many things well.
customer_reviews.author: Big Lou

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this product to work. Needed to fax some information to a medical insurance company on my father's behalf. Gave up and pursued a different alternative. Maybe your luck would be better than mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Garcon

customer_reviews.title: The price was great and delivery was on time
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple mono laser/fax for my home office. The price was great and delivery was on time. I've purchased three Brother machines over time and I like the way that they resemble one another each time I get a new one. Familiarity is nice when you get a new product and don't want to have the tech guy come to the house to set it up because you can't. Even if you have never owned a Brother machine before, you should have no trouble. These things are bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: john dougherty

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I have two Brother laser fax machines. Neither will work although they look brand new. The problem is that the machine falsely states "Replace Drum Unit" and "Replace Toner Cartridge" after I have put a new one (and then several new ones). It then stops printing anything. I will never buy another Brother product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gaines, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent machine.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fax machine hoping for an improvement over my HP copier that has an incorporated fax machine. I believe that the Brother 2840 is an excellent buy, it works just great, fine quality machine, great print quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good Not Great Fax Machine
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat fast fax. Does not print as legible as I would like, but it prints like a fax would. I thought the laser printer would help the resolution but it doesn't. Copies are nice on the machine as a feature; but again, you are better off using a real copier instead. Changing the times in the sleep mode in the menu helps a LOT. It's a serviceable fax machine for a home office or a small office.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: A dedicated fax machine.
customer_reviews.text: Changed from a tape fax machine to a toner. Works great. Print quality is good. Unfortunately you can hear the beginning of the connection (the high pitch whining). The sound goes away after about 7 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Has a utility that runs from a PC (via usb printer cable) that makes setup very easy. Also allows you to save a backup file ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't hardly used it yet, but seems to be a well built unit. Has a drawer to hold approx a full ream of paper. Has a utility that runs from a PC (via usb printer cable) that makes setup very easy. Also allows you to save a backup file of your setups. Only main issue is the LCD display has no backlight and had to turn the contrast level to max to be able to read display.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Lemley

customer_reviews.title: Junk

customer_reviews.title: BEST FAX MACHINE EVER -  WAY BETTER THAN 5 STARS!

customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Koenker

customer_reviews.title: Display doesn't light up.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this printer

If it breaks I will probably get another one

It also gets jammed about once every 4 faxes received.

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain for the money.

The only issue I have is that it goes into a deep sleep and there is no way to prevent it from doing so. I knew this from all the previous reviews I read about this particular fax machine. I would recommend it for sending faxes and have not received any faxes so I don't know if that is an issue.

customer_reviews.title: Not Wireless
customer_reviews.text: This printer is advertised as wireless. However, when I attempted to setup the wireless functionality, the wireless setup instructions included with the printer were not compatible with the printer. For example, the instructions say to press the GO button located on the top left of the printer, but there is no GO button on the printer. I emailed Brother customer support for assistance with the setup. The email response I received from Brother customer support is that this printer is not wireless.
customer_reviews.author: KSR_Alph

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one machine!
customer_reviews.text: This fax/copy/print machine replaced an old antiquated fax machine for our office. Brother has good quality devices. This is the second Brother machine that we have purchased because of the quality. So many features we do not use, but they're there if we need them. Faster sending than our old machine. The paper drawer is one of the features I like because of the capacity and the type of feed that is probably less likely to wear out as with our old machine. I highly recommend this device by Brother!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality laser fax machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Brother Intellifax Model 2820 which had developed some problems with the feeding of paper. This model is a bit faster, prints very cleanly and sharply, has a voice receiver option and functions very well. It was a good purchase.

customer_reviews.title: No wakeup problems.
customer_reviews.text: Just follow the straightforward setup process outlined -- no problems encountered. Note we found none of the wakeup problems from "deep sleep" mentioned in other reviews. Perhaps Brother fixed the problem with the newer units. We run an answering machine and telephone on the same line. No problem. Brother included a second phone line port to accommodate the answering machine and the 2840 is smart enough to recognize an incoming call or FAX. We are very pleased so far with this machine at a great price. $140 included shipping.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, and a very good copier also

product_meta.title: Brother FAX-2840 High Speed Mono Laser Fax Machine, Dark/light gray - FAX2840
product_meta.description: Style:FAX2840The IntelliFAX-2840 is a laser fax that is ideal for home offices or small offices. It features a 33.6K bps modem, 16MB memory and a 20-page capacity auto document feeder for faxing and copying multiple pages. This compact fax offers up to 272 broadcasting locations, 200 speed dial locations, 22 one-touch keys and can even receive fax and voice calls on the same telephone line. It has a generous paper tray capacity of 250 sheets and a USB interface for future printing capability. Also, an optional high capacity replacement toner cartridge is available to help lower your cost per page.
